definition: beginning of spring/the lunar New Year

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Farmers begin to sow shortly after the coming of spring.
sentences.chinese: 開春後，農民們開始耕田播種了。

sentences.english: Now winter was approaching, and the voyage would not be made before the following spring.
sentences.chinese: 不過現在冬天快來了，在開春以前，是不能航海的。

sentences.english: The next year, they make the same New Year's resolutions.
sentences.chinese: 翌年開春，他們又如法炮製了同樣的計劃。

sentences.english: No spring bloom had done up until the time fall short of months to come.
sentences.chinese: 未見花開春已盡，待到秋來月又缺。

sentences.english: When spring came, it brought two floods.
If freeze damage occurs, you should wait until spring before pruning avocado trees.
sentences.chinese: 如果出現鱷梨樹凍傷，你應該等到開春纔可以修剪。

sentences.english: Although the real estate market become warmer in the Spring 2009, but the future trend remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 2009年開春市場有所回暖，但未來走勢仍未明朗。

definition: timing (of a signal or sequence)/time course
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
report of success/report of a victory
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
